newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sumitomo doesn't think Hamanaka manipulated market.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo doesn't think Hamanaka manipulated market.

text.p: Sumitomo Corp has found no evidence that its former chief copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka manipulated the world copper market, a top official said on Tuesday.

"That is one of the key points of our internal investigation. So far we haven't found evidence that Hamanaka was manipulating the world copper market," Sakuo Nanba, general manager of Sumitomo's legal department, told Reuters.
"We don't think he was manipulating the world copper market," he added.

Nanba spoke to Reuters following a news conference by Sumitomo at which it said it had filed a formal complaint against Hamanaka for forgery and planned to file another complaint against him for breach of trust.
Tokyo prosecutors announced on Tuesday they had arrested Hamanaka on charges of forgery.
Sumitomo fired Hamanaka in mid-June and blamed him for an estimated $2.6 billion in losses from unauthorised trades.
